page.title: 17LIFE STYLES
page.content:
There are 4 public houses in the Cubert/Holywell area.{ The Treguth {Inn,}a l3th century listed thatched building at Holywell which has 2 bars and a children's room.
{The St. Piran's Inn,}frequented by the army being almost adjacent to the camp, has 2 bars, a garden and also 3 flats. { {The Tree Tops Inn}in Cubert has one bar and a garden while{the Smugglers' {Den}at Trebellan also has a restaurant. This is another listed thatched building dating from Elizabethan times.
The 2 restaurants are{The Anvil Grill} which seats l00 and{The Lantern}50. Both open Easter until Oct/November.
